abstract: Disc 1: Ep 1 For all debts public and private--Ep 2 No show--Ep 3 Christopher--Disc 2: Ep 4 The Weight--Ep 5 Pie o my--Ep 6 Everybody hurts--Ep 7 Watching too much television--Disc 3: Ep 8 Mergers & acquisitions--Ep 9 Whoever did this--Ep 10 The Strong, silent type--Disc 4: Ep 11 Calling all cars--Ep 12 Eloise--Ep 13 Whitecaps
description: Episode of Series "The Sopranos". Season four of this award-winning television series created by David Chase. The dark exploration of masculinity, abuse and violence which is central to this series exemplifies what is unique to The Sopranos: terrific writing, outstanding performances and a daring audacity to fully explore the brutality of contemporary culture in the US. The mores and ethics of organised crime seem an apt metaphor for the capitalist system. Ep 1 "For all debts public and private" Tony tries to raise cash for investments, whilst Carmela pushes for traditional insurance. Uncle Junior frets about his impending trial. Ep 2 "No show" With Paulie behind bars, Christopher is assigned his turf. Meadow considers taking a year off college. Ep 3 "Christopher" The first Soprano trial in 16 years commences; Italian pride causes an array of troubles. Ep 4 "The Weight" Johnny Sack embarks on a bloody vendetta; Carmela develops a close relationship with Furio, encountering Tony problems. Ep 5 "Pie o my" Carmela and Tony continue to disagree over the finances; Uncle Junior faces problems in court. Ep 6 "Everybody hurts" Tony gives greater responsibility to Christopher; Meadow joins the right side of the law. Ep 7 "Watching too much television" Tony and the gang throw a release-party for Paulie. Furio finds himself attracted to Carmela. Ep 8 "Mergers & acquisitions" Tony meets an attractive art dealer; Paulie tries to integrate his mother into her nursing home; Carmela discovers a new source of income. Ep 9 "Whoever did this" Uncle Junior develops a new defence strategy; Tony brings Svetlana back into their lives; tragedy strikes Ralph's son. Ep 10 "The Strong, silent type" Tony tracks down Ralph; Furio struggles with his feelings for Carmela; Christopher's heroin addiction turns catastrophic. Ep 11 "Calling all cars" Dreams persue Tony through the night; Tony contemplates business decisions; Dr Melfi works on the undercurrents of Tony's dreams but he wants out. Ep 12 "Eloise" Tony haggles over profits; Paulie's loyalty is called into question. Ep 13 "Whitecaps" Tony battles to keep the family together.
